title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oakland University
Interview Descriptions: Easy, this is for college students. Great staff, great work, overall very fun job. One interview and I got the job. I highly recommend working here as an Oakland University student.
Interview Questions: When will you be able to start?

title: Admissions Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Oakland University in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: One 90 minute interview broken up into two segments; one with the direct Admissions team, the other with larger scale leadership team. Each segment about 45 mins. This was the only interview in the process, no secondary interview (one and done style). No phone screen prior.
Interview Questions: -Questions surrounding your personal philosophy towards teamwork -Asked for specific example of large scale projects and events you ran, asking for details of how you broke down the projects step by step -Questions about how you incorporate DEI efforts into your work

title: Associate Linux Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oakland University
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward and efficient.  People asked technical questions. I was interviewed by one of the people in the office who was a full-time engineer. He tried to evaluate my existing knowledge.
Interview Questions: What do you know about Linux?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oakland University
Interview Descriptions: The process was phone then in-person; was a good process that was simple and made sense. I liked interviewing with this company and I would recommend it for those interested in higher education.
Interview Questions: Strengths and weaknesses; tell me about yourself

title: Senior IT Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oakland University
Interview Descriptions: Arranged through a search firm, the interview process was professional and the committee was engaged. Like most higher Ed institutions the process took a long time as expected. The communication was very good.
Interview Questions: What are you passionate about that this position offers?

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oakland University
Interview Descriptions: Slow moving interview process - they have to wait until a job closes to review applicants, so if you apply right when something opens - you may not be reviewed until much later.
Interview Questions:
Q: Describe your relationship development skills
Q: What are your strengths/weaknesses

title: Admissions Adviser Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oakland University
Interview Descriptions: I took part in a phone interview that inquired about qualifications. Everyone was very friendly and did a great job of describing the role and its benefits. I was happy to hear about the salary and benefits at the start of the process, as well as the recruitment territory.
Interview Questions: Describe situations in which you have worked with diversity?

title: Student Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Oakland University
Interview Descriptions: My application was via handshake for part-time employment. I received an email for a  Google meets Interview which was an hour long. They asked general HR type questions at first and then directed the questions towards the technical part required on the job. Within a week I got an email that I was selected and received my offer letter.
Interview Questions: How comfortable are you working in a team environment

title: Medical Librarian (MLS) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 9 months. I interviewed at Oakland University (Detroit, MI) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: It took 9 months from when I applied to when I did my last interview. They were lovely people, but were not interested in speed in the least.  Standard initial zoom interview, and a second all day zoom affair complete with presentation.
Interview Questions: 1 hour presentation around the topic of Diversity and Inclusion within the Medical Library.

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oakland University
Interview Descriptions: I had only one in-person interview that lasted about an hour. It was a panel style interview and consisted of mostly behavioral type questions. They were mostly looking for my past experience in advising and how I would structure future outreach to students.
Interview Questions: What is a typical day for an advisor?

title: Veteran Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Oakland University
Interview Descriptions: In person, on campus. Briefed on responsibilities, reporting, and asked to submit hours of availability during the semester. Met all of the employees, and given a tour of the office.
Interview Questions: Would you be able to work certain days of the week?

title: Events Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Oakland University (Rochester Hills, MI) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and within a week or so got an email to set up a phone screen. I was brought back for an in-person interview a week later with two members of the team. They made the final decision within about 5 days of the in-person interview and I got an automated email sharing that they hired another candidate.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest strength/weakness?

title: Academic Peer Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Oakland University in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was quite lengthy with a couple interviews weeks apart. The people were always very nice, but for it being a lot of people's first big former interview, it was slightly intimidating.
Interview Questions: They asked what super power I would pick if I could have one. Never knew it was a hard question until I was asked why.

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Oakland University (Sterling Heights, MI) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: First, professor met with me and asked me about my skills and how I could be useful to him. We then had several meetings and workshops before I was finally admitted.
Interview Questions: Projects I have worked with.

title: Career Consultant Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Oakland University (Rochester, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Spent a 1 hr 15 min interview with operations manager and senior director. Started with "tell me about yourself" and "why do you want this position." Answered a lot of questions in regard to previous experience advising students, strengths/weaknesses, communication and teamwork. I was glad I prepped ahead of time with a mock interview since this was very comprehensive.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oakland University
Interview Descriptions: Relaxed, friendly. Very down-to-earth and sincere in approach to conversation during interview. Really approachable, non-intimidating like some interviews. Lasted about 45 minutes. Parking on campus was difficult but that is with most universities.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to teach at Oakland University?

title: Student Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Oakland University (Auburn Hills, MI) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very accommodating and allowed me to take the interview via phone as I lived further away from the office on campus. Very simple questions, such as my capabilities and things like am I a team player and how I am involved on campus.
Interview Questions: Would you be willing to move in early and begin working a week before the semester for training?

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Oakland University (Rochester Hills, MI) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Brief and to the point. You are tested on life guarding skills, CPR, and general interview questions. They are curious about your morals, values, social skills, and outlook on life. Make sure they know how much you value human life and being selfless.
Interview Questions: If you have to stay late due to a scheduling miscommunication, would you?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Oakland University (Rochester, MI) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: After a few back-and-forth emails to gain basic info and set up an in-person interview, my interview took less than an hour and both interviewers were very polite, professional, and friendly. They simply wished to go over my previous work experience and learn a little more about my accomplishments and publication (listed on the resume). They were very kind and made sure they answered all of my questions.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have that pertains to this job?

title: Help Desk Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Oakland University (Rochester, MI) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Sat down with 1-2 leaders of the department and asked several behavioral and technical questions. They would then write down your responses on paper while you answered. There were about twenty five to thirty questions total. The interviewers were very nice and accommodating. You did not need to know the answers to all of the questions, they were just trying to get a feel for your technical level and personality.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness?

title: Orientation Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Oakland University (Rochester, MI) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly! Challenging for a student, but it teaches you a lot. They have you prepare a "commercial" to sell OU to prospective students, very fun. Not intimidating at all, very friendly office.
Interview Questions: What is your leadership style like?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Oakland University (Rochester, MI) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for the Graduate Research Assistant position. They asked about my past research experiences and passion. I explained my experiences in human subjects research as well as my side projects that I worked on outside of research.  It was a great experience and I learned a lot from the process.
Interview Questions: How interested am I about the project?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oakland University
Interview Descriptions: There isn't really an interview process, you get a recommendation from the professor of the course in which you will be tutoring. That professor will contact the individual in charge of the tutoring center and he/she will decide whether or not to offer you the position.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to tutor?

title: Academic Adviser Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Oakland University (Rochester, MI) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions:
-Interviewed first with the staff of the Academic Advising unit I applied for
- Next interview round was with administration of the academic unit
- Polite and cordial process
- Most interviews in higher ed seem to be with a panel of potential staff members, this interview was consistent. 
- Allowed the interviewee to see the personalities of those who you might be working with
Interview Questions: Why Oakland?

title: Student Network Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Oakland University (Rochester, MI) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I was interviewed by 3 other people. The first half was behavioural questions. For this portion expect "Tell us about yourself" ,etc. 
The second half was technical questions. They told me at the beginning they do not have any expectations for this section and that it is OK to say you don't know. If you took CSE 247 take a look at your notes because will help you for that part.
Interview Questions: What are the layers of the OSI Model.

title: Student Network Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Oakland University (Rochester, MI)
Interview Descriptions: There will be 3 interviewers asking you a series of tech-related questions, as well as situation based questions. You do not have to be extremely tech savvy, just have good people skills. They are able to train you to do a lot of the tasks that will be needed of you.
Interview Questions: Name the layers of the OSI Model.

title: Teaching Assistant At Oakland University Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Oakland University (Rochester, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Applied to the dept directly and they had shortlisted me - had a brief interview which was very informal. After a month I was emailed that I was awarded a TA and had to sign few papers. I had to take 8 credits in upcoming semester
Interview Questions: Nothing as such. It was very easy. Probably my grades helped me

title: Causal Employee Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Oakland University (Rochester Hills, MI) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was smooth because I am allumni and fit the qualification. Also the boss is very nice and just causal convesation during the interview. I am very happy with the management bc they all are nice people .
Interview Questions: What is your experience

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Oakland University
Interview Descriptions: Apply by filing up admission document. You will reply from graduate school.Depending on your scores and graduate school criteria , one will be able to get admission.It will take some time for this process. Maybe around 2-3 months
Interview Questions: There was no difficult question. Just apply online.One doesn't has to pay application fees. It will take some time for this process. Maybe around 2-3 months.Depending on your scores and graduate school criteria , one will be able to get admission.

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oakland University
Interview Descriptions: I actually walked in looking for a job & they were looking for an assistant so I was hired on the spot.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Oakland University (Auburn, MI) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was very straight forward. The job was found online through the career network website on campus. The interviewers were both leaders of the technology team in the school of business. Very professional and done quickly.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with troubleshooting hardware and software in a domain environment?

title: Student Helpdesk Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Oakland University
Interview Descriptions: I had applied online through OU Career Link and received a call back from them after a week or so. They called me for an in person interview in which I was asked a series of technical questions and work experience. A couple days later I was made an offer. I recommend sending a thank you email after the interview.
Interview Questions: I was asked to identify various computer pieces and other technical troubleshooting questions.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oakland University
Interview Descriptions: Job was posted on career link of the school
Interview Questions: How do you handle project failure

title: Assistant Professor, Accounting Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oakland University in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: mostly behavioral questions, background check. I didn't enjoy the interview process. Got back to me within 2 weeks. I needed to prepare a statement that elaborated on my previous experiences within the university
Interview Questions: why would you like to work here

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Oakland University (Rochester Hills, MI) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: I knew a lot of the people going into my interview. I wasn't really tested like I would've been otherwise. Very relaxing environment. There was no pressure. I didn't know how to answer all of the questions, but I didn't feel like there was any judgement. They knew that I was a student and they knew that I wouldn't know how to solve all the problems.
Interview Questions: Asked a few questions about my background, and asked me to solve a few simple programming challenges.

title: Economics Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Oakland University (Rochester, MI) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: the hiring process is mostly consistent of the tutor scoring high grades in the subject they wish to teach.I had a 3.0 GPA but had earned a 4.0 in managerial economics which seemed to be a difficult class that many business majors struggled with. due to a high score in that class and there being an opening I was pretty much instantly hired and the next step was filling out paper work for employment.
Interview Questions: when are you available and when can you begin

title: Student Helpdesk Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Oakland University (Auburn Hills, MI) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by Helpdesk Coordinator and another student tech. I was asked general knowledge questions about Winodws and Mac computers. I was asked to answer some scenarios about how to handle difficult personalities, telephone etiquette when answering a phone call.
Interview Questions: What are some technology sites you like to visit on a regular basis?
